statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: SOUTHLAND CONF TR AT HOUSTON TX

article.headline: Texas A&M-Corpus Christi 80, SE Louisiana 72
article.story: HOUSTON (AP) -- Cedric Smith scored 17 of Texas A&M-Corpus Christi's 38 bench points in the Islanders' 80-72 win over Southeastern Louisiana in the first round of the Southland Conference men's tournament Thursday night. After leading 45-31 at halftime, the top-seeded Islanders had to withstand a second-half challenge by the Lions, who began the second half with a 31-19 run to get within two points at 64-62. Texas A&M-Corpus Christi got some key scores inside from senior post Chris Daniels and converted free throws to hold off the Lions, who lost their fourth straight game. Kevin Menefee scored 14 points and had a game-high 12 rebounds. Josh Ervin added 12 points for Texas A&M-Corpus Christi, which won the league's regular season crown in its first season in the conference. Southeastern Louisiana (16-14) was led by guard Daryl Cohen's 18 points. Forward Joseph Polite scored 13, and guard Terry Bryant finished with 12, although he was 3-of-15 from the floor. Daniels, a 7-0 center who was named the league's Player of the Year Tuesday, was held to 10 points, all of them in the second half, and eight rebounds. The Islanders won their fourth straight game despite committing 26 turnovers.
